result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

08:50 AM Defendant Antonio V Anderson in court, in custody, with attorney Eugene E. Detert.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective Steven Guth of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by DDA Michael Thurston.
Cross examination by attorney Detert.
Redirect by DDA Thurston.
Recross by attorney Detert.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Detert

10:10 AM Defendant Antonio V Anderson in court, in custody, with attorney Eugene E. Detert.   Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called to address material witness warrant in 22GF285. Court modifies dates on the bond to the new trial dates.
Affidavit of Service of Protective Order filed by Karen Kulinski
Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A in all cases  listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

Hearing on June 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Hearing on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:33 AM Defendant Antonio V Anderson in court, in custody, with attorney Eugene E. Detert.   Attys Molly M Schmidt and Alyssa Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State filed the motions requested by the court so they could be addressed today.
The State filed a Motion to Rescind Communication Privileges from the jail.
State and Defense make arguments on the record.
The Court grants the motion in part and will issue a protective order with the conditions listed on the record.
Court resets the trial date to accomodate availability of witnesses.
State had kept pre-trial offer available until today's hearing.
Defendant rejects offer from the State. 

The State filed a Motion for Deposition of Other Acts Witness.
State and Defense make arguments on the record.
The Court denies the Motion for reasons as stated on the record.

  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.  Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.

COURT ADDED A CONDITION TO BOND.

Shall not use any of the communication systems within the jail, including phone, video, and mail to contact Victim A in 21CF878 and 21CF1938 and Victim A in 22CF889.
The Defendant is prohibited from using the phone to communicate with anyone except his attorney. Defendant is prohibited from using anyone elses PIN.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A (or their children) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 2 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Rescind the Defendant's Communication Privileges within the Jail;  filed by the State  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 6/6/22 - The Court will address at the hearing on 6/7.*
Notice of Motion and Motion to Rescind the Defendant's Communication Privileges within the Jail;  filed by the State
Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim * listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading.
